alert.note: Alert for Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 24 at 5:35PM PST until February 24 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Fresno, Kings and Tulare. * WHEN...Until 845 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 535 PM PST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in Selma. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Selma is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fresno, Sanger, Reedley, Selma, Parlier, Kingsburg, Del Rey and Fowler. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
